definition: tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳

sentences.english: She was so tender and beautiful, and for your cry has responded with silence.
sentences.chinese: 她那麼嬌豔，對你的呼求卻報以沉默。

sentences.english: Clasp a rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore.
sentences.chinese: 擁抱被天使叫作麗諾爾的少女，她美麗嬌豔。

sentences.english: I plucked all the blossom in my garden into wreaths.
sentences.chinese: 我摘下我花園中所有的嬌豔，把它們織成各個桂冠們。

sentences.english: What is so-called TASTY? Just take a look at this and you would definitely understand it.
sentences.chinese: 什麼叫做嬌豔欲滴，看看這個，你就徹底明白了。

sentences.english: Jiao-Yan is one of chrysanthemums in full bloom, in the stria left.
sentences.chinese: 是一朵嬌豔盛放的菊花，紋在左腰。

sentences.english: The delicate and charming China rose in the tomb garden.
sentences.chinese: 在陰霾天空下，陵園裏分外妖嬈嬌豔的月季。

sentences.english: The  Chinese flowering crabapple looks still even  more  charming against  the  green leaves.
sentences.chinese: 在綠葉的映襯下，海棠花顯得更加嬌豔。

sentences.english: At the ball the lady in red appeared very charming, and gorgeous.
sentences.chinese: 舞會上，那位紅妝女郎嬌豔欲滴。

sentences.english: GeShangHua Beautiful beautiful. Because of the snow-covered plateau of the moisture Ganlu.
sentences.chinese: 嬌豔美麗的格桑花，是因爲有雪域高原甘露的滋潤。

sentences.english: As the front of the flowers open, beautiful, elegant fall.
sentences.chinese: 如那眼前的花朵，開時嬌豔，落時飄逸。

sentences.english: The roses have never been so beautiful.
His face was strangely pale, but his lips were like a proud red flower.
sentences.chinese: 他的臉異常蒼白，而嘴脣卻好似一朵嬌豔的紅玫瑰。

sentences.english: Tender and beautiful, such as by, fickleness is empty.
After working , colourful clothes replace the blue uniforms.
sentences.chinese: 放工之後，藍制服都換成了顏色嬌豔的衣服。

sentences.english: In the fall season, gardenia has its dance, beautiful, beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 在這飄零的季節，梔子花擁有它的舞姿，美麗，嬌豔。

sentences.english: A spring rain let these delicate and charming flowers scattered.
sentences.chinese: 一場春雨讓這些嬌豔欲滴的花兒散落一地。

definition: venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
